edu.jsu.mcis

Class ArgsParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jsu.mcis.ArgsParser

  • public class ArgsParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates arguments, parses the command line, and returns their values.

    The major functions of this class are to properly add arguments and parse the command line (or any other String array). Other functions exist to return information about the argument(s) or the program. Example code using ArgsParser: 

                    
			public static void main(String[] args) {
				ArgsParser p = new ArgsParser();
				p.setProgramName("VolumeCalculator");
				p.setProgramDescription("Calculate the volume of a cube, cylinder, or sphere.");
				p.addArg("length", Arg.DataType.FLOAT, "the length of the box (float)");
				p.addNamedArg("digits", Arg.DataType.INTEGER, "2", 'd');
				p.parse(args);
			}
		
                
                    Example command line arguments:
                VolumeCalculator 7.5 2.4 --type cylinder 8.2 --digits 3

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgsParser

        public ArgsParser()
        Default constructor. Initializes new HashMaps and ArrayLists for storing Args.

    • Method Detail

      • addMutualExclusion

        public void addMutualExclusion(java.lang.String[] arguments)
        Adds a group of named arguments that are mutually exclusive. No more than one of the named arguments in the group should be present in the command line.
        Parameters:
        arguments - a string array with all the names of arguments desired to be mutually exclusive.

      • getMutualExclusion

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getMutualExclusion()
        Gives a List of all mutual exclusion (String arrays) that exists for the ArgsParser instance.

        An example List would look like the following: [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]

        Returns:
        a List of String[] that contains argument names.

      • getPositionalArgumentNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPositionalArgumentNames()

        the List of names of positional Args currently being stored by ArgsParser.
